title: (x) Photogra semi serif font - Pilgrim {Marius}
content:
Can anyone Identify this font for me? ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050618084815im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70524.jpg)   
   
Thanks very much.
author: rapt

comments.content:
Sure   
   
How's this?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050618084815im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70532.jpg)   
   
   
I'm just using the upload attachment option when posting. If I should be doing something different please let me know.
Whoops hit the button too many times\</font\>

Whoops, it turned out to be okay when I reloaded the page after my post, I don't know why it didn't show up the first time. I guess I was just anxious to see if I could get a quick post in and then edit once I saw the pic for a super-fast ID, but... ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050618084815im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

[Invoice](http://web.archive.org/web/20050618084815/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/testpilot/invoice/regular/testdrive.html?s=PHOTOGRAPHY&p=60) or [New Age](http://web.archive.org/web/20050618084815/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/new-age/new-age/testdrive.html?s=PHOTOGRAPHY&p=48) are closer but neither is an exact match.
Yeah its the bases of the characters that really seem to be the key, as its moderately similar to many semi serif fonts besides that.
Where is this sample from? Is it a logo? Do you have any lowercase or other characters?
Its from a business card, its all upper case sadly but there are a couple more letters. An R and a Y to be exact.

which did NOT come up in a search for semi-serif...   
   
Nice find!

I'll have to remember that 'hybrid' category at MyFonts, since these styles seem to come up often.   
   
Good job Marius.
They don't know what to do with all those T-26 fonts, do they?
